meanings.definition: Jarks (noun): a type of small, sharp object
meanings.sent1: I stepped on a jarks and it hurt my foot.
meanings.sent2: The jarks on the ground were difficult to see.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten batted around the jarks like they were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like jarks, piercing through the silence.
meanings.sent5: The jarks scattered on the floor glittered in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Jarks (verb): to move quickly and suddenly
meanings.sent1: The squirrel jarks up the tree to escape the dog.
meanings.sent2: She jarks out of bed when she hears the alarm.
meanings.sent3: The magician jarks from one side of the stage to the other in a blink.
meanings.sent4: The idea jarks into his mind out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: The athlete jarks across the finish line, winning the race.

meanings.definition: Jarks (adjective): describing something sharp or sudden
meanings.sent1: The jarks pain shot through his arm after the injection.
meanings.sent2: The jarks turn in the road surprised the driver.
meanings.sent3: The jarks wind made the trees sway violently.
meanings.sent4: Her jarks wit always caught people off guard.
meanings.sent5: The jarks sound of thunder echoed through the valley.
